definition: to cleanse by or as if by the action of liquid (such as water)
to remove (something, such as dirt) by rubbing or drenching with liquid
to cleanse (fur) by licking or by rubbing with a paw moistened with saliva
to flush or moisten (a bodily part or injury) with a liquid
to wet thoroughly : drench
to overspread with light : suffuse
to pass a liquid (such as water) over or through especially so as to carry off material from the surface or interior

to flow along or dash or overflow against                                      
             
             waves washing the shore

to move, carry, or deposit by or as if by the force of water in motion                                      
             
             houses washed away by the flood
to subject (something, such as crushed ore) to the action of water to separate valuable material
to separate (particles) from a substance (such as ore) by agitation with or in water
to pass through a bath to carry off impurities or soluble components
to pass (a gas or gaseous mixture) through or over a liquid to purify it especially by removing soluble components
to cover or daub lightly with or as if with an application of a thin liquid (such as whitewash or varnish)
to depict or paint by a broad sweep of thin color with a brush

to cause to swirl                                      
             
             washing coffee around in his cup

launder sense 3                                      
             
             how the mob washes its money through corrupt bankers
to wash oneself or a part of one's body
to become worn away by the action of water
to clean something by rubbing or dipping in water

to become carried along on water : drift                                      
             
             cakes of ice washing along

to pour, sweep, or flow in a stream or current                                      
             
             waves of pioneers washing westward

to serve as a cleansing agent                                      
             
             this soap washes thoroughly

to undergo laundering                                      
             
             this dress doesn't wash well

to undergo testing successfully : work sense 3                                      
             
             an interesting theory, but it just won't wash

to gain acceptance : inspire belief                                      
             
             the story didn't wash with me
to disclaim interest in, responsibility for, or further connection with
a piece of ground washed by the sea or river
bog, marsh
a shallow body of water
a shallow creek

the dry bed of a stream                                      
                —      called also
        dry wash
the act or process or an instance of washing or being washed
articles to be washed, being washed, or having been washed
the surging action or sound of waves
worthless especially liquid waste : refuse
an insipid beverage
vapid writing or speech

a sweep or splash especially of color made by or as if by a long stroke of a brush                                      
             
             in the gray wash of early morning
a thin coat of paint (such as watercolor)
a thin liquid used for coating a surface (such as a wall)
lotion
loose or eroded surface material of the earth (such as rock debris) transported and deposited by running water
backwash sense 1
a disturbance in a fluid (such as water or the air) produced by the passage of an airfoil or propeller
a situation in which losses and gains or advantages and disadvantages balance each other

involving essentially simultaneous purchase and sale of the same security                                      
             
             spurious market activity resulting from wash trading

washable                                      
             
             wash fabric
Washington
to clean (something) with water and usually soap
to carry (something) by the movement of water
to be carried by the movement of water
an act of cleaning something by using water and soap : an act of washing something
a group of clothes, towels, sheets, etc., that are being washed or that are going to be washed
the movement of water

to cleanse with water and usually a cleaning agent (as soap)                                      
             
             Wash your hands and face.

to wet completely with liquid                                      
             
             The flowers were washed with raindrops.

to flow along or overflow against                                      
             
             Waves wash up on the shore.

to remove or carry away by the action of water                                      
                

            Wash the mud off the car.
    
                

            She was washed overboard.

to stand being cleansed without injury                                      
             
             Linen washes well.
articles (as clothes, sheets, and towels) in the laundry

an act or instance of cleansing or of being cleansed                                      
                

            We gave the car a good wash.
the flow, sound, or action of water
a backward flow of water (as made by the motion of a boat)
material carried or set down by water
to cleanse by or as if by the action of liquid (as water)

to flush or moisten (a bodily part or injury) with a liquid                                      
             
             wash the wound with saline solution
to pass through a liquid to carry off impurities or soluble components
a liquid medicinal preparation used especially for cleansing or antisepsis  — see eyewash, mouthwash
in: waves washing the shore
houses washed away by the flood
washing coffee around in his cup
how the mob washes its money through corrupt bankers
cakes of ice washing along
waves of pioneers washing westward
this soap washes thoroughly
this dress doesn't wash well
an interesting theory, but it just won't wash
the story didn't wash with me
the warm wash of applause that followed her … introduction
in the gray wash of early morning
spurious market activity resulting from wash trading
wash fabric
We have to wash the dishes.
Did you wash your hands?
The flooding washed sand and silt all over the area.
The pollution washes into rivers from nearby factories.
Water washed over the deck of the ship.
Waves washed up onto the beach.
My jeans are in the wash.
We could hear the wash of the waves against the rocks.
The wash from speedboats is dangerous for swimmers.
Wash your hands and face.
The flowers were washed with raindrops.
Waves wash up on the shore.
Linen washes well.
wash the wound with saline solution

definition: to clean something, usually with soap and water
to clean a part of your body, usually with soap and water
if the sea washes an object somewhere, it carries it there
if the sea washes an area of land, it touches it
if a feeling washes over or through you, you feel it very strongly and unexpectedly
used to tell off someone who has just said something inappropriate such as cuss words
in: I’ve got to wash the car.
a freshly washed shirt
Wash your hands before you touch the food.
He washed and dressed quickly.
washed ashore: Some very strange things get washed ashore here.
The island’s western shore is washed by the warm waters of the Pacific.
She felt anxiety wash over her.
something does/will not wash
wash your hands of

definition: to clean something using water:
to clean yourself, or a part of yourself, with water and usually soap:
If a particular material or piece of clothing washes well, it is not damaged or spoiled by repeated washing.
If water washes somewhere, it flows there, usually repeatedly:
(of the sea) to carry something or someone to or away from a place:
the action of washing something or a part of your body:
all the clothes, sheets, etc. that are washed together, especially in a washing machine:

→ 
        
         washing
to wash your body or a part of it:
to clean clothes, sheets, etc., usually in a washing machine:
a thin layer of water or paint mixed with water, especially one that is brushed lightly over a painting to make the lines softer:
an event or situation in which positive and negative things balance each other:
(the sound made) when the sea moves against land, etc.:
to make something or yourself clean, or to become clean, using water and usually soap:
(esp. of water) to flow or to cause to flow, often carrying something along:
If something is washed away, it is carried off by heavy rain or a flood:
If something washes up or washes ashore, water has moved it there:
an act of washing, or clothing, sheets, and other cloth items being cleaned together:
in: wash your hair/hands
wash the car/clothes/floor
